cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 105 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to resume a slow west-north-west drift tonight, then turn north-west and parallel the Florida east coast before curving northeast toward the Georgiaâ€“South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal encounter along the Florida east coast between Jupiter Inlet and Ponte Vedra Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge watches extend from Deerfield Beach FL northward to South Santee River SC on the Atlantic side
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (Atlantic coast) and Storm-Surge Warning Lantana FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas, Florida east coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a 16 % chance of sustained 34-kt (gale-force) winds; 50-kt risk below threshold
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Gulf side; surge threat confined to Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible, totals generally below 4 inches on the west-central Florida coast
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional squalls and hazardous marine conditions in Tampa Bay and the approaches (higher seas, rip currents)
